result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa M. Woolley

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 1:30 p.m.
INCLUDES: 21CF1394, 21CF1603, 22CF156.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck in person. Defendant appears in person with Atty Andrew Morgan.
VRCW.
Date and time set for a bail/bond hearing.

ADA Boeck notes no motion has been filed.
COURT addresses parties.
Atty Morgan agrees the motion has not been filed, but would still like to be heard today re: modifying bond.
ADA Boeck objects to proceeding.
Atty Morgan requests a no contact order to be dropped.
COURT declines to make a ruling today, requests defense to file a motion and schedule future bond mod hearing with JA.

Dates to remain.

Adjourned: 1:35 p.m.
From defendant, requesting to dismiss felony case

Case Called: 9:08a.m.
Clerk:  Micki.
INCLUDES 21CF1394, 21CF1603, and 22CF156

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck.
Defendant appears in person; with Attorney Andrew Morgan.

Date and time scheduled for a JPTC/TPD.

ADA Boeck advises court state has provided settlement offer to defense.
Atty Morgan makes statement regarding settlement offer. Requests another PTC for a month out. 
COURT addresses parties as to another court date.
Atty Morgan makes statement regarding bond modification. He will file motion.

DATES:
CC: 5/26/22 at 8:05a.m. (Atty Morgan can call in; Defendant is excused)
PTC: 6/14/22 at 10:05a.m. (Defendant must personally appear)

ADJ: 9:14a.m.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on May 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Clerk: Nikki.
Case Called: 9:38am.
INCLUDES 21CF1394, 21CF1603, 22CF156.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in person and with Atty Andrew Morgan.

Parties do not have an agreement at this time.
Atty Morgan has received an offer from the State; he is not yet appointed to deft's newest case and requests additional time for State to provide a new offer.
COURT addresses deft re: financial status and SPD.

DATES:
JPTC/TPD: 5/25/22 @9:00am.

Adjourned: 9:43am.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): A.K. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk: Nikki. 
Case Called: 2:34pm.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence. Defendant appears in person, and with Atty Andrew Morgan.
VCRW.
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction.
Court questions defendant re: complaint and rights.
Prelim Time Limits Waived.

COURT ORDERS BOND:
$1000.00 signature.

CONDITIONS:

-Prints and photograph.
